newsitem.title: NICARAGUA: Nicaragua inflation rises 0.02 percent in February.
newsitem.headline: Nicaragua inflation rises 0.02 percent in February.

text.p: Nicaraguan consumer prices rose by 0.02 percent in February, maintaining January's low inflation rate, Nicaragua's Central Bank reported on Monday.
Cumulative inflation for the first two months of 1997 was 0.04 percent.
Year-over-year inflation through February 1997 totalled 10.87 percent. Inflation in February 1996 rose by 1.06 percent.

The monthly cost of basic goods -- food, clothing and household products for a family of six -- rose by 56.39 cordobas ($6.20) in February to a total of 1,356.69 cordobas ($149.09) fed largely by the rising cost of household goods, the Central Bank said.
State workers such as teachers and nurses earn about $60 per month.
